DOC.brief_summary: This study examine two side brain interact learning precision hand movement . Both side brain active person performs accurate hand movement . This study look extent two brain hemisphere interact learn accurate hand movement . Healthy , right-handed normal volunteer 18 - 40 year age may eligible study . Candidates screen clinical neurological examination . Participants randomly assign one two group - precision non-precision hand movement . All participant undergo follow procedure : - Force precision task : Subjects press small device thumb index finger . The force produce fingertip translate onto computer screen . Subjects track white line pass screen fingertip . - Paired-pulse transcranial magnetic stimulation ( TMS ) : A wire coil hold subject 's scalp . A brief electrical current pass coil , create magnetic pulse stimulate brain . During stimulation , subject may ask tense certain muscle slightly perform simple action . The stimulation may cause twitch muscle face , arm , leg , subject may hear click feel pull sensation skin coil . The effect paired-pulse TMS muscle detect electrode tap skin arm leg . - Surface electromyography ( EMG ) : This test measure electrical activity muscle . For test , electrode fill gel tap skin muscle test . The study involve six session . Sessions 1-5 consecutive day ; session 6 one week session 5 . - Session 1 : Familiarization motor task baseline measurement , include error rate , EMG , paired-pulse TMS - Session 2 : Training motor task repeat measurement session 1 - Session 3 : Training measurement session 2 - Session 4 : Training measurement session 2 - Session 5 : Training measurement session 2 - Session 6 : Measurements
DOC.brief_title: Interaction Right Left Brain Hemispheres Learning Precision Hand Movements
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose protocol investigate change interhemispheric inhibition ( IHI ) human motor cortex learn performance accurate motor task ( pinch force control ) . Performing simple motor task associate activation contralateral motor area . Activation ipsilateral motor/premotor cortex might elicit perform challenge difficult unimanual motor task . However , functional role play ipsilateral activation controversial , felt prominent complex task . Several study use paired-pulse transcranial magnetic stimulation ( TMS ) reveal significant IHI active upon non-active hemisphere . Together result suggest IHI motor cortical area may play critical role motor control could influence manual dexterity . Taking account , raise interest question whether IHI balance motor cortex progressively modify learn phase accurate motor task . We hypothesize learn perform track motor task require accurate control pinch force generation ( Tracking accurate ) , increase IHI `` learning '' `` non-learning '' hemisphere large extent learn perform less precise tracking motor task ( Tracking non-accurate ) . The primary outcome measure amount change IHI `` learning '' `` non-learning '' hemisphere function learn motor task .
DOC.criteria: INCLUSION CRITERIA Healthy volunteer eligible study : age 1840 year ; righthanded ; able perform task require study ; willing able give consent EXCLUSION CRITERIA Healthy volunteer eligible study : unable perform task ; lefthanded ; history neurological psychiatric illness , alcohol drug abuse severe language disturbance serious cognitive deficit ; uncontrolled medical problem , heart , lung kidney disease , epilepsy diabetes mellitus , severe tactile deficit ( define Frey filament exert force 4 N distal pad finger ) ; cardiac pacemaker , intracardiac line , implant medication pump , neural stimulators , metal cranium , exception dental brace .
